intro: Leucospermum meisneri, commonly known as the yellow star flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, seed-containing follicles after flowering. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is complemented by its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
